We‚Äôre super excited to reveal LEGO Braille Bricks are now available for families to play with at home‚ù§ With braille, printed letters, numbers and symbols on each brick, and supporting games for all ages, the new LEGO Braille Bricks ‚Äì Play with Braille set makes learning braille more fun and accessible to the whole family. The perfect invitation for everyone to get involved!

#LEGO #BrailleBricks #Braille #LearningThroughPlay 

Video description: Video showing three different families playing with LEGO Braille Bricks as they talk about the potential these bricks have in making learning braille more fun and engaging. 
The bricks shown are based on 2x4 LEGO bricks that are fully compatible with other LEGO bricks, and come in five colours (yellow, green, blue, red and white). The set includes two grey baseplates to build on and comes in packaging with braille embossing. The video shows how a series of supporting play starters available on LEGO.com can help enhance the play experience and support pre-braille skill development through well-loved games such as Rock, Paper, Scissors, which all members of the family can take part in.

At this LEGO brick molding factory in Billund, raw material is taken, heated and colored before being molded into LEGO elements. They are then cooled and moved to our high bay warehouse, which stores around 8 billion LEGO elements at any time. From there, the newly molded bricks are securely packed and loaded onto trucks to make their way out into the world üöö 

At least that‚Äôs what happens during the day...

#LEGO #DayInTheLife #Satisfying #AFOL

#AD What‚Äôs your superpower? Mine‚Äôs creativity. It‚Äôs been the vehicle on my journey to doing what I love. I learned how to be creative as a child playing with my sister. We turned the toys we had into magical mystery adventures- cars became boats that took us to planets far away. As an adult, that same creativity I built as a child has enabled me to take the characters I play on their own magical adventures.

I‚Äôm so excited to be part of @LEGO‚Äôs new Play Is Your Superpower campaign because I know first-hand the amazing skills that play builds in children, like creativity, confidence and resilience. Which is why I intend to prioritize it for my kid. (tbh, I don‚Äôt know who has more fun though üòÑ) 
 
To find out how Play is Your Superpower visit LEGO.com/SuperpowerOfPlay

If I didn‚Äôt play as a child, I wouldn‚Äôt be who I am today. You have to play to slay, duh!!

No but seriously, play gave me a superpower that helped me make my dreams a reality. That superpower was imagination. My imagination has taken me from styling my favourite flowers in my imaginary florist as a kid, to styling my favourite people on a global stage today.

With the new additions in our family, playtime is a priority in my household and I encourage you to make it a priority in yours too. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so proud to be supporting @LEGO ‚Äôs new Play Is Your Superpower campaign that hopes to inspire families to make that tiny bit more time for play in their day. Let‚Äôs build some superpowers!

#AD Crocs might have epic strength and koalas may have incredible hearing, but we humans are also lucky enough to have superpowers. Yes, all of us!
I believe that play gives us all the power to reach our full potential, so I‚Äôm proud to be teaming up with @LEGO to help encourage families to reprioritise play in their day and find out for themselves what superpowers play gives them.
For me, play as a child taught me the superpower of connection, both to others and to the world around me. My favourite place to play was in a treehouse that my dad built for me- it was where I felt most connected to him and to the nature I love so much. Being able to connect with other people and the world around me is a superpower that has benefitted me throughout my life and that‚Äôs why I make sure that I prioritise playtime for my family- so they can develop their own superpowers. I hope we inspire everyone to do the same for the kids in their lives!
To find out how Play is Your Superpower visit LEGO.com/SuperpowerOfPlay

Our collaboration has felt like a full circle moment as a few years ago I went on a course to get over my fears of insects and to learn more about these amazing creatures and the sounds they make! Now with the LEGO Group I‚Äôve really been able to put my studies into practice and bring to life the sounds of these incredible insects that can so often be misunderstood.¬†¬†
¬†
This was a first at my studio and challenged me to be incredibly creative with my approach to Foley!
¬†
Find out more about the LEGO Green Noise playlist and The Insects Collection at‚ÄØLEGO.com/insects. Available globally in LEGO stores or online from 4th September for LEGO Insiders and 7th September for all.

@brickmasteramy (Amy Corbett) designs LEGO sets. üß±Wait. That‚Äôs a job!? 

When Amy was studying product design engineering in college, she realized there was one must-have element for her job search: fun. ‚ÄúI loved the feeling of making something playful and full of joy,‚Äù she recalls. Fast forward 10 years, and Amy now gets to play with toys for a living. She‚Äôs a senior design manager and product lead at the Denmark headquarters of @lego and a judge on @LegoMastersFox.

Working at the LEGO Group is Amy‚Äôs dream job. As a designer, it means that her core medium is bricks. She believes that visualizing the people she‚Äôs designing for is the secret to epic toy creation. ‚ÄúI ask myself, ‚ÄòWould little Joey actually want to play with this? How would they tell their friends about it? What kind of stories would they tell when role playing?‚Äô We put kids at the center.‚Äù Finding a mentor is also key: ‚ÄúI've always looked for someone I admire at work, to ask for advice and learn from.‚Äù But her biggest piece of advice? Work on what you love. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be afraid to dig deep, find your superpower and then create a unique career around it ‚Äì because you‚Äôre going to be doing it for a long time.‚Äù üí°

LEGO career goals? ‚ú®üê¶ 

Nico V√°s is a LEGO designer who specializes in creative play experiences. He has designed many iconic LEGO sets including the Bonsai Tree. The new Pastel LEGO Classic set featured in this video was co-designed by Nico and George Gilliatt with the hopes of creating a selection of bricks that enable builders of all ages to create amazing builds from their own imaginations. On the day we filmed with him, Nico happened to be searching for inspiration for a bird minibuild but could equally be found trawling through the archives for vintage building instructions or working with other LEGO Designers on new ways to inspire creativity. We hope your day is filled with cute LEGO builds just like Nico‚Äôs! üê¶

üéÇ Happy Birthday LEGO DUPLO üéÇ

Today marks 50 years since we unveiled the big brick for little hands. Starting with a handful of bricks in set number 510 and 511, you can now get LEGO DUPLO animals, trains, doctors, scientists, cheeky kids, hipster parents and anything your imagination can build.

LEGO DUPLO bricks are twice the size of classic LEGO bricks in all dimensions, which is why the name DUPLO derives from the Latin word ‚Äòduplex‚Äô (meaning double). Grab a slice of this cake and share your memories of growing up with LEGO DUPLO.  #LEGO #LEGODUPLO #Birthday
